definition: to watch sb closely/to breathe down sb's neck/to mark (sports)
to watch attentively/to fix one's attention on/to stare at/to gaze at
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: I expected that the Queen does not enjoy being gawked at.
sentences.chinese: 我想女王不会喜欢被人傻乎乎地盯住不放。

sentences.english: He fixes his eyes on the greyish spine of the old wolf as he swoops down.
sentences.chinese: 他两眼死死盯住老狼灰黑的脊背。

sentences.english: When the old granny first came to the city, she goggled at the size of the buildings.
sentences.chinese: 当老太太初次进城时，她瞪大眼睛盯住那一座座高楼。

sentences.english: John watched every opportunity because he wanted to get on.
sentences.chinese: 约翰盯住每一个机会，因为他想获得成功。

sentences.english: He was nobbled by the press who wanted details of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 新闻界紧盯住他不放，要了解事件的详情。

sentences.english: People in many countries kept their eye fixed on TV screens.
sentences.chinese: 很多国家的人民紧紧盯住电视荧光屏。

sentences.english: Your eyes should naturally gaze at the middle of the computer screen.
sentences.chinese: 你的双眼应该可以自然的盯住电脑屏幕的中间。

sentences.english: Focus on cutting off the bottom third of the ball.
sentences.chinese: 盯住来球的下面的三分之一的部位。

sentences.english: With half an eye Soapy saw that the policeman was watching him fixedly .
sentences.chinese: 他斜眼望去，看见那个警察正死死盯住他。

sentences.english: He knows that when the government gets you in their crosshairs, you stand very little chance of getting out.
sentences.chinese: 他知道当政府盯住了你，你就没什么机会逃得掉。

sentences.english: The player stared at the board in a dazed way.
sentences.chinese: 投环的人目瞪口呆地盯住木板看。

sentences.english: At this time, my eyes fixed on it filled with dirty clothes in the laundry basin.
sentences.chinese: 这时，我眼睛盯住了那装满脏衣服的洗衣盆。

sentences.english: To see the illusion, look at the center of the circle and notice the peripheral shimmering.
sentences.chinese: 想看到这个幻视，盯住圆心，注意边缘的闪烁。

sentences.english: I waited patiently until he stared directly at me.
sentences.chinese: 我耐心地等待着，直到它终于直直地盯住我为止。

sentences.english: The patronus did not answer the question, choosing instead to stare at Ron with great intensity .
sentences.chinese: 守护神并没有回答，而是目光灼灼地盯住罗恩。

sentences.english: Washington's cornerbacks are fast enough to cover man-to-man.
sentences.chinese: 华盛顿队的角后卫速度很快，足以盯住对手。

definition: to watch attentively/to fix one's attention on/to stare at/to gaze at
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
to run one's eyes over/to sweep one's eyes over
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
to glower (at sb)/to cast an angry look
